post_text:
Denver City Football Tickets – Online Sales Only – No Ticket Sales at the gate!

Go to www.DCISD.org. Under quick links at the left of the page---Click on athletic ticket sales, there will be a page come up that says buy tickets. Click on that page and buy as many as you want. There will be a code sent to their phone. Code will be scanned at the gate. The tickets should go on sale Monday. All visitors will enter the East gate behind the visiting bleachers. Face coverings must be worn at all times including in the stands.

Remote learners needing assistance with Hot Spots and/or laptops. Please e-mail tgau@lfdisd.org if your child is still waiting to receive a laptop for remote learning. Feel free to contact Tim Gau at 325-718-8715. Technology would like to make sure all remote learners have what they need to access remote learning online.

post_text:
In order to receive attendance credit, students unable to access online classes must contact their campus front office to notify them you're having difficulties connecting.

Please remove the back cover and battery to check for SIM cards.

Hot Spots with no SIM card must contact Technology at 325-718-8715.

If Hot Spot has a SIM card, put battery back in and pop the back cover back on. Turn Hot Spot on and you should have access.

Laptop checkout for At Home Remote Learners Only for HS, JH and Elementary families that were unable to attend Friday's session.

Students participating in the “At Home Remote Learning” educational process at Littlefield ISD, may checkout their school provided laptop equipment at the Littlefield High School Wildcat Gymnasium.

Students must have selected remote learning in order the district to have a laptop ready when attending the pickup session.

The pickup time will be on Saturday, August 15th from 12 noon to 2 PM.

The district is requesting all students in the same household to attend together.

Please wear a mask and practice social distancing.

Face-to-Face learners will receive their school issued technology at the beginning of school.

post_text:
Parents and Staff,

Littlefield ISD Administration has been notified that a High School student has tested positive for COVID-19. The student is currently self-quarantining at home.

LISD is continuing to deeply sanitize, and all District employees and students are instructed to continue to follow CDC guidelines and recommendations and to practice social distancing.

Based on the information that we have gathered, it has been determined that the end of the 14-day incubation period for anyone possibly exposed to the student is August 26.

Out of an abundance of caution, we advise you to monitor your health, follow the CDC guidelines for people who have had close contact and contact your primary care physician if you develop symptoms.

Littlefield ISD is continuing to monitor this situation and will provide additional information as needed. We hope for a successful recovery for our treasured staff member. Sincerely,

Robert Dillard,
Superintendent Littlefield ISD
text:

post_text:
http://www.lfdisd.org/

Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) Benefits

Information can be found on the Littlefield ISD Website http://www.lfdisd.org/

Quick Lings to: P-EBT Letter to Parents, How to Apply, P-EBT English Flyer, and P-EBT Spanish Flyer can be found on the main district website.

What is P-EBT?

P-EBT is a one-time benefit of up to $285 and will be issued on an EBT card to assist families during this unanticipated school closure.

All children who attend Littlefield ISD, a school that offers free meals to all students (Community Eligibility Provision or Provision 2) should be eligible to receive P-EBT benefits.

The P-EBT application will be open the first week of June.

All other families will have until June 30, 2020 to complete the application. Once approved, a P-EBT card will be mailed to your household.

For more information, please visit hhs.texas.gov/PEBT.

Seniors,

The LEARN Representative, Sara Moreno will be working from home and will be available to assist students as needed.

Her work cell is 806-201-1738 or e-mail her at smoreno@learnprograms.org

She will also start calling/contacting each Senior Wednesday, April 15, to keep up with the LHS bi-monthly meetings.

If you are not sure about the status of your Financial Aid, PLEASE contact Mrs. Moreno ASAP. You do not need to put this off.

If you have any questions, please call LHS, 806-385-4150 Ext. 2100

Texas, remember the importance of social distancing. If you must go out, avoid public spaces and keep your distance from others (at least 6 feet). If we continue to follow valuable public health guidance, fewer of our friends & family will be affected by COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas

post_text:
English
#COVID19 lives on droplets in the lungs of people with the virus, even if they don’t have symptoms. When infected people breathe, the virus enters the air. If you can’t #StayHome, wear a mask/scarf/bandana, stay 6 feet apart, and wash your hands. #DontGoViral

Spanish:
#COVID19 vive de gotas en los pulmones de las personas con el virus incluso si no tienen síntomas.Cuando las personas contagiadas respiran, el virus entra al aire.Si no puedes quedarte en casa #StayHome, use una bufanda/pañuelo, manténgase a 6 pies de distancia y lávese las manos

post_text:
Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.

Spanish
Los síntomas comunes de #COVID19 son fiebre, tos seca y dificultad para respirar.Si tiene síntomas leves, llame a su médico y quedate en casa.Si desarrolla síntomas graves, como dificultad para respirar o presión en el pecho, busque atención médica de inmediato. #StayHome

post_text: Before social distancing, each person with #COVID19 spread the virus to 2.5 more people. At that pace, most would get it, and many more people would die. But we can slow the spread. That’s why we all #StayHome. #ApartTogether we slow coronavirus.

post_text:
Practice Social Distancing

To avoid the spread of COVID-19 in our community, practice social distancing:
• Avoid going out in public
• When in public, keep six feet of distance between you and others
• Follow guidance provided by local and state officials.
Get more information at https://texas.gov/covid19
#covid19 #texasstrong #stayhome



Practica el distanciamiento social

Para prevenir la propagación de COVID-19 en nuestra comunidad, practique el distanciamiento social:
• Evite salir en público
• Cuando esté en público, mantenga una distancia de seis pies entre usted y los demás.
• Seguir las recomendaciones de los funcionarios locales y estatales.
Obtenga más información en https://texas.gov/covid19
# covid19 #texasfuerte #quedateencasa

post_text:
PRIMARY LETTER UPDATE: March 27, 2020 6:00 PM

Primary staff would like to THANK all our parents for showing they are making every effort for our students continued learning. 100% of our students have received instructional packets with information for students to complete work through April 3. Additional material WILL NOT be available for Primary students until April 6.

If schools remain closed after April 3, we will notify parents (prior to April 6), of the plans for additional material distribution. Work will not be returned until your teacher lets you know of a need to return it. Teachers will continue to monitor students completing Waterford (PK – 1st), and Prodigy & Epic (2nd grade).

Thank you also for being patient with the calls in order to determine the best manner to provide continued learning.

Please check the Primary website for updates, and know your teacher is there for you! Email your teacher with any questions or concerns.

Thank you again for your cooperation and continued support of Littlefield Primary and LISD.

Littlefield Primary
text:
PRIMARY LETTER UPDATE: March 27, 2020 6:00 PM

Primary staff would like to THANK all our parents for showing they are making every effort for our students continued learning. 100% of our students have received instructional packets with information for students to complete work through April 3. Additional material WILL NOT be available for Primary students until April 6.

If schools remain closed after April 3, we will notify parents (prior to April 6), of the plans for additional material distribution. Work will not be returned until your teacher lets you know of a need to return it. Teachers will continue to monitor students completing Waterford (PK – 1st), and Prodigy & Epic (2nd grade).

Thank you also for being patient with the calls in order to determine the best manner to provide continued learning.

Please check the Primary website for updates, and know your teacher is there for you! Email your teacher with any questions or concerns.

Thank you again for your cooperation and continued support of Littlefield Primary and LISD.

Littlefield Primary

In order to allow Littlefield ISD staff members and students to attend funeral services honoring former School Nurse Missy Hobbs, classes will dismiss for Spring Break on Thursday, March 12, at 12:00. Buses will run at that time.

There will be NO SCHOOL ON FRIDAY, March 13.

School will resume on March 23rd at regular school times.

Please be safe over your Spring Break.

post_text:
In order to allow Littlefield ISD staff members and students to attend funeral services honoring former School Nurse Missy Hobbs, classes will dismiss for Spring Break on Thursday, March 12, at 12:00. Buses will run at that time.

There will be NO SCHOOL ON FRIDAY, March 13.

As a result of these schedule changes, Littlefield ISD will have a regular school day on Friday, March 27, which was previously scheduled as a Focus Friday.

Please feel free to call your Campus Principal if you have any questions.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation.

Thank you,
Robert Dillard

post_text:
Parent Portal interface is changing!

Littlefield ISD is pleased to announce the release of Ascender's Parent Portal, which is replacing the existing Parent Portal called txConnect. The conversion will be completed at 4:00 pm on Friday, February 28th. If you have an existing valid account in txConnect your existing username and password will work with the new Parent Portal Ascender. Instructions will be included on the Ascender Parent Portal page for parents to download.
text:
Parent Portal interface is changing!

post_text:
Littlefield ISD Schedule Clarification

The purpose of this message is to clarify the schedule for FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.

This FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020, was originally scheduled as a FOCUS FRIDAY.

However, because we canceled classes on TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 11, 2020, we will have a regular school day on FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.

All students are required to attend school for a full day on FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.

If you have any questions please call Central Office (806-385-3844) for clarification.

post_text:
Littlefield ISD Schedule Clarification

The purpose of this message is to clarify the schedule for TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 11, 2020, WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 12, 2020, THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 13, 2020, and FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.

There are no classes today, TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 11, 2020.

We will follow a regular schedule on WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 12, 2020 and THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 13, 2020, as originally scheduled, unless conditions warrant a schedule change.

This FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020, was originally scheduled as a FOCUS FRIDAY.

However, because we canceled classes on TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 11, 2020, we will have a regular school day on FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.

All students are required to attend school for a full day on FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 2020.



If you have any questions please call Central Office (806-385-3844) for clarification.



Have a safe day.

Littlefield At Denver City Game Change
Due to possible inclement weather, our High School basketball games that were scheduled to be played in Denver City on Tuesday have been rescheduled and will be played tomorrow night (Monday) instead. The schedule is as follows:
5:00 JV Boys/Girls
6:15 Varsity Girls
7:30. Varsity Boys
** The JH games may be rescheduled to be played Thursday night.
